message: Doug, so just because it is in a article you allow Valwood, Maclay, and others, (only 30% of schools in the SE started in that time period are listed here) to be libeled?  I think you are missing the point-this is not the time to misrepresent good schools

not fare to make such a broad statement, check the charters and history from the founders.  Just because it happened in the time period does not mean that the founders were motivated by that issue.  Yes, it was happening, but check the story...
Okay, so is the edit "fair".  It does not whitewash the page, but gives the other side of the conversation...which has been left out - give me some suggestions if this is not acceptable

Reverted 1 edit by [[Special:Contributions/Maclayfriend|Maclayfriend]]: If you can't spell fair, ya gotta wonder. rv blatant whitewashing. we don't care what the school wants to say about itself. the independent sources are clear. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
Undid revision 795653865 by [[Special:Contributions/Maclayfriend|Maclayfriend]]  Maclay School started as a segregation academy, this editor tried to remove that from the school's article
